title: Red Receives a Warning
summary: Red's mother instructs her to deliver medicine and food to her sick grandmother deep in the woods, warning her not to stray from the path. Red questions the urgency but agrees, motivated by concern for her grandmother. She reluctantly accepts her mother’s silver knife for protection, foreshadowing danger.

title: A Strange Encounter on the Path
summary: While traveling through the forest, Red is approached by a mysterious, charming stranger who asks probing questions about her destination and purpose. Sensing unease, Red lies about the location of her grandmother’s house. The stranger, whose true motives remain hidden, subtly threatens Red before vanishing into the trees.

title: The Wolf’s Deception
summary: The stranger—revealed as a monstrous wolf in disguise—races through a shortcut to reach Grandmother’s house first. He forces his way into the cabin, terrorizes Grandmother, and imprisons her in a locked cupboard. The wolf then disguises himself in her clothing, preparing to ambush Red.

title: Red’s Suspicious Arrival
summary: Red arrives at the cabin and immediately notices oddities in her ‘grandmother’s’ appearance and voice. She grows suspicious and tries to delay entering fully, but the disguised wolf insists she comes closer. Red decides to test the imposter by asking pointed questions about family memories only her grandmother would know.

title: The Attack and Escape
summary: The wolf, losing patience, reveals his true form and lunges at Red. Red uses the silver knife given by her mother to wound the wolf and manages to barricade herself inside the pantry. The wolf, enraged and injured, tries to break in as Red desperately searches for a way to free her grandmother.

title: Rescue and Confrontation
summary: Hearing Red’s cries, a nearby woodsman breaks into the cabin. He and Red work together: Red distracts the wolf while the woodsman frees her grandmother from the cupboard. A violent struggle ensues, ending when Red uses her knife to deliver a fatal blow to the wolf, motivated by her need to protect her family.

title: Aftermath and a New Warning
summary: With the wolf dead, Red tends to her injured grandmother and thanks the woodsman for his help. Red’s mother arrives, having followed the trail of blood, and the family debates whether the woods are safe. Red decides to warn others in the village, determined to prevent future attacks and vowing never to ignore such warnings again.
